meta.title: Clarens San Traverse
meta.description: A 3-day slackpacker offering high berg wilderness and cultural treasures - San paintings, dinosaur fossils, fine restaurants, quirky art cafes and intriguing African folk-lore tales.

longDescription: The Clarens San Traverse is a 3-day slackpacker offering the unique combination of high berg wilderness and cultural treasures. The area is famous for its landmark San paintings, well-preserved dinosaur fossils, fine restaurants, quirky art cafes and intriguing African folk-lore tales.
Our charismatic guide will lead you safely from one destination to the next, whilst sharing his unique perspective on ancient culture and the stories of the people who once inhabited this valley.

details.heading: Trip Duration
description: 3 Hike Days / 3 Nights
* Shorter and longer variations

details.heading: Daily Distances
description: Day 1: 17km
Day 2: 14km

details.heading: Trail Grading
description: 2-3/ 5 for Fitness.
2-3/ 5 for Technicality Mostly cleared paths and farm roads. A few sections of off-camber grassy trails and a few steep ascents and descents.

details.heading: Trail Terrain
description: The terrain varies between well maintained hiking paths, mountain paths, ravine trails and rocky ridges.

details.heading: Accommodation
description: Comfortable farm stays & 3-star lodges

details.heading: Logistic Support
description: A fully guided and catered lodge-to-lodge tour with vehicle back-up and daily luggage transfers. Return transfer provided.

details.heading: Group Size
description: Min of 4 persons and max 12-14 persons per group.

details.heading: Pricing
description: On a full group of 8-12 persons: R5000/pp/sharing

frontmatter.emailSubject: Clarens San Traverse Hike Enquiry – PP Enquire Now

overview.heading: At a Glance
description: Daily distances and pace are quite manageable, making this an excellent trail for families and persons looking to test-out the trail waters.

You will overnight in charming country houses, just outside of Clarens. With meals, transfers and luggage transfers all arranged for, all you need to do is wake up and enjoy the golden-lit sandstone trails, so unique to this part of the world.

itinerary.heading: Day 1
description: Self-drive to the trail head near Clarens, Free State.
Overnight: St Fort (dinner)

itinerary.heading: Day 2
itinerary.subHeading: Hike Day 1: St Fort to Schaaplaats (17km / 7hr hike)
description: Breakfast at St Fort. Gradual hike up the scenic ravine onto the high Basothu grasslands.
Overnight: Schaaplaats Country Guesthouse -offering twin/double en-suites and communal bathrooms (breakfast, packed lunch, dinner)

itinerary.heading: Day 3
itinerary.subHeading: Hike Day 2: Schaaplaats to Rock Art Paintings (13.5 km / 5 hr)
description: Hike through farmland and up along a river trail to visit a national monument rock art cave paintings. Continue along the grassland ridge with dramatic views of Lesotho and the Caledon river.
Drivers will be transferred back to collect their vehicle at St Fort.
Overnight: Schaaplaats Country Guesthouse (breakfast, packed lunch, dinner)

itinerary.heading: Day 4
itinerary.subHeading: Hike Day 3: Clarens Historical Walk (5.5km-10km / approx 2-4 hr hike)
description: Self-drive to Clarens for a historical walk through the village onto the circular trails of the Clarens Conservancy.
Restaurant lunch in Clarens for own account.

images.heading: A fallow field amongst Clarens Sandstone
Caves and overhangs provide a shady rest-spot

lodging.heading: Lodges
description: Homely farmstays and country lodges - 3-star equivalent. Most rooms are ensuite, but some of the rooms will share a bathroom. Breakfasts and dinners will be prepared and served at your overnight lodgings.

images.heading: Original Sandstone cottage, St Fort - First nights  accomodation.

faq.question: Do we carry our own backpacks?
answer: No. Vehicle luggage transfers will be provided between your overight locations on this slackpacking trail.

faq.question: What type of footwear is appropriate?
answer: Worn in hiking boots or a more rugged hiking shoe with a decent rubber sole.

faq.question: What is the best time of year for this trail?
answer: Any time outside of peak school and public holiday periods. But April/May is when the cosmos is in flower .

pictures.caption: Much of the San traverse trail passes over and under Clarens Sandstone.
Start of the first hike day, leaving St Fort Country House.
A neat ladder has been constructed to get over this boulder.
The Free State in Spring – a cosmos wonderland.
Bat Cave – aptly named
Learning about the medicinal and hallucinogenic properties of some of interesting plant species along the way.
Imphepho (a Helichrysum)  in flower –  the herb is traditionally burnt to invoke, honour and placate the ancestors.
Freshly ploughed, fallow fields provide a cinematic contrast to their surrounds.
Final day of the Clarens San Traverse – the approach back to Clarens town.
Striking Red Hot Pokas at the entrance of our second nights accommodation.
Creative interpretation on the local rock art sites. This guide will take you on a whole new trip.
This river crossing may prove a bit more of a challenge during Summer months.
Sandstone caps the horizon on the 3 day Clarens San Traverse Hiking trail.
Over the Rainbow
Large parts of the trail are on exposed sandstone domes.
There are some cool forest sections too – with ancient Ou hout trees.
Up and over
The first Bird of Prey sighting on the days trail.

price.heading: At a Glance
overview: Price varies based on group size, but indicative price based on a full group size (8-12 persons) - R5000/pp
includes: 3 Nights Accommodation - based on a double or twin sharing basis
All Meals: 3 packed/picnic/restaurant lunches for the hike days and 3 dinners and breakfasts at your accommodation
